sense.name: flatulence
sense.commentary: GAS[+event] a state of excessive gas in the alimentary canal
sense.examples: After eating the cheese, she had gas. Don't eat beans before your interview, they'll give you gas.

sense.name: accelerator
sense.commentary: accelerator pedal, gas pedal, throttle, gun - a pedal that controls the throttle valve
sense.examples: He stepped on the gas and sped off down the road. Her foot slipped off the gas and she caused an accident. Is the gas on the left or the right?

sense.name: gasoline
sense.commentary: gasolene, petrol - a volatile flammable mixture of hydrocarbons (hexane and heptane and octane etc.) derived from petroleum; used mainly as a fuel in internal-combustion engines
sense.examples: Sport Utility Vehicles use a lot more gas than small cars. We'll have to stop on the way because I'm low on gas. The price of gas is always rising.

sense.name: natural gas
sense.commentary: a fossil fuel in the gaseous state; used for cooking and heating homes
sense.examples: In the winter they use a lot of gas ot heat their huge house. My landlord pays for gas.

sense.name: not liquid
sense.commentary: the state of matter distinguished form the solid and liquid states by: relatively low density and viscosity; relatively great expansion and contraction with changes in pressure and temperature; the ability to diffuse readily; and the spontaneous tendency to become distributed uniformly throughout any container
sense.examples: At a certain temperature the substance turns in to gas. Matter is something with mass and is a solid, liquid, plasma, or gas.
